Name: Silver Coin of Alexander the Great with Elephant Headdress
Description: The silver coin bears a portrait of Alexander the Great looking to the right and wearing the elephant leather headdress and the horns of Amun. The elephant leather refers to his triumph in India. The horns indicate that he is considered to be a son of Amun, the principal god of Egypt. On the reverse, the Greek goddess Athens is depicted holding the sword with her right hand and the shield in her left hand. The name of Alexander is inscribed in Greek in a column behind the goddess. This coin was minted in Alexandria, perhaps slightly before or after the accession of Ptolemy the First Soter of the throne of Egypt.
